title: Principles of Trauma-Informed Care in Timor-Leste

questions.question: What are the five core principles of trauma-informed care?
choices: Safety, trustworthiness, choice, collaboration, and empowerment
Confidentiality, respect, empathy, support, and healing
Assessment, treatment, recovery, follow-up, and prevention
Cultural awareness, sensitivity, competence, adaptation, and integration
questions.answer: Safety, trustworthiness, choice, collaboration, and empowerment

questions.question: Which historical event in Timor-Leste is specifically mentioned as a source of trauma?
choices: World War II
The 1999 independence referendum
The Asian Financial Crisis
The 2006 East Timorese crisis
questions.answer: The 1999 independence referendum

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'safety' principle in trauma-informed care?
choices: To provide financial security
To ensure physical and emotional security in the environment and interactions
To guarantee job security for trauma survivors
To establish legal safety measures
questions.answer: To ensure physical and emotional security in the environment and interactions

questions.question: How can trustworthiness be demonstrated in the Timorese context?
choices: By imposing Western healing practices
By maintaining strict confidentiality at all times
By respecting cultural norms and traditions
By prioritizing individual needs over community needs
questions.answer: By respecting cultural norms and traditions

questions.question: What is an example of applying the 'choice' principle in Timor-Leste?
choices: Mandating a single treatment approach for all patients
Offering traditional and modern healing options
Limiting options to reduce decision-making stress
Allowing only Western-trained professionals to provide care
questions.answer: Offering traditional and modern healing options

questions.question: How is collaboration demonstrated in trauma-informed care in Timor-Leste?
choices: By making decisions for clients without their input
By working together with clients/patients as equal partners
By collaborating only with Western-trained professionals
By excluding traditional healers from the care process
questions.answer: By working together with clients/patients as equal partners

questions.question: What is an example of empowerment in the Timorese context?
choices: Imposing Western values on local communities
Highlighting resilience in post-conflict recovery
Discouraging traditional practices
Centralizing decision-making power
questions.answer: Highlighting resilience in post-conflict recovery

questions.question: What is Uma Lulik in Timorese culture?
choices: A type of traditional food
A sacred house
A healing ritual
A government building
questions.answer: A sacred house

questions.question: What is Tara Bandu in Timorese culture?
choices: A traditional conflict resolution practice
A type of traditional medicine
A sacred animal
A harvest festival
questions.answer: A traditional conflict resolution practice

questions.question: Which language is NOT mentioned as commonly used in Timor-Leste?
choices: Tetum
Portuguese
Local languages
Mandarin
questions.answer: Mandarin

questions.question: How can healthcare providers balance respecting traditional beliefs with providing evidence-based trauma treatment?
choices: By completely rejecting traditional beliefs
By integrating traditional healers into care teams
By only using evidence-based treatments
By ignoring evidence-based practices
questions.answer: By integrating traditional healers into care teams

questions.question: What is a challenge in implementing trauma-informed care in Timor-Leste?
choices: Excessive funding
Too many trained professionals
Language barriers due to multiple local dialects
Overreliance on traditional healing practices
questions.answer: Language barriers due to multiple local dialects

questions.question: How can the principle of 'choice' be applied in a culture that emphasizes collective decision-making?
choices: By ignoring collective decision-making entirely
By only allowing individual choices
By balancing individual options with family and community involvement
By eliminating all choices to avoid conflict
questions.answer: By balancing individual options with family and community involvement

questions.question: What role can storytelling play in trauma-informed care in Timor-Leste?
choices: It has no relevance to trauma-informed care
It can be used as a therapeutic tool aligned with oral traditions
It should be discouraged as it reinforces trauma
It is only useful for children, not adults
questions.answer: It can be used as a therapeutic tool aligned with oral traditions

questions.question: How might the concept of 'empowerment' be understood differently in Timorese culture compared to Western interpretations?
choices: It may focus more on community empowerment rather than individual empowerment
It is exactly the same as Western interpretations
Empowerment is not valued in Timorese culture
It only applies to political leaders
questions.answer: It may focus more on community empowerment rather than individual empowerment

questions.question: What is an important consideration when creating a trauma-informed care plan for a local organization in Timor-Leste?
choices: Ignoring local cultural context
Focusing solely on Western psychological approaches
Including specific adaptations for Timorese cultural context
Avoiding all traditional practices
questions.answer: Including specific adaptations for Timorese cultural context

questions.question: How can trauma-informed care principles be integrated into existing community conflict resolution practices like Tara Bandu?
choices: By completely replacing Tara Bandu with Western practices
By incorporating safety and empowerment principles into the Tara Bandu process
By ignoring Tara Bandu entirely
By using Tara Bandu only for minor conflicts
questions.answer: By incorporating safety and empowerment principles into the Tara Bandu process

questions.question: What is a key aspect of creating a physically and emotionally safe environment for patients in a Timorese health clinic?
choices: Using only Western medical equipment
Ignoring local customs and traditions
Creating well-lit spaces and providing clear information about services
Separating patients based on their trauma experiences
questions.answer: Creating well-lit spaces and providing clear information about services

questions.question: How can patient choice be incorporated into treatment options in Timor-Leste?
choices: By offering only traditional healing methods
By providing a combination of traditional and modern treatment options
By limiting choices to reduce confusion
By allowing only family members to make treatment decisions
questions.answer: By providing a combination of traditional and modern treatment options

questions.question: What is an example of a collaborative approach with traditional healers in Timor-Leste?
choices: Excluding traditional healers from the care process
Using only traditional healing methods
Integrating traditional healers into care teams alongside modern practitioners
Replacing all traditional healers with Western-trained professionals
questions.answer: Integrating traditional healers into care teams alongside modern practitioners

questions.question: How might you empower patients and the community in the healing process in Timor-Leste?
choices: By making all decisions for them
By ignoring community input
By providing skills training alongside emotional support
By focusing solely on individual therapy
questions.answer: By providing skills training alongside emotional support

questions.question: What is a key consideration when addressing intergenerational trauma in Timor-Leste?
choices: Focusing only on the younger generation
Ignoring historical context
Understanding the impact of past conflicts on family and community dynamics
Treating all generations the same way
questions.answer: Understanding the impact of past conflicts on family and community dynamics

questions.question: How can non-verbal communication norms be respected in trauma-informed care in Timor-Leste?
choices: By ignoring non-verbal cues
By using only verbal communication
By learning and respecting local non-verbal communication customs
By imposing Western non-verbal communication norms
questions.answer: By learning and respecting local non-verbal communication customs

questions.question: What role do extended family networks play in trauma-informed care in Timor-Leste?
choices: They are irrelevant to the care process
They should be excluded from all treatment decisions
They can provide important support and context for healing
They should make all decisions for the individual
questions.answer: They can provide important support and context for healing

questions.question: How can trauma-informed care principles be applied in Timorese schools?
choices: By ignoring trauma altogether
By creating a trauma-informed classroom environment
By separating traumatized students from others
By focusing only on academic achievement
questions.answer: By creating a trauma-informed classroom environment

questions.question: What is an important consideration when addressing trauma related to the Indonesian occupation?
choices: Ignoring the historical context
Focusing only on individual experiences
Understanding the collective nature of the trauma
Avoiding any discussion of the occupation
questions.answer: Understanding the collective nature of the trauma

questions.question: How can cultural competence be demonstrated in providing emotional support in Timor-Leste?
choices: By imposing Western emotional expression norms
By ignoring cultural differences in emotional expression
By integrating Timorese cultural values into emotional intelligence practices
By discouraging any emotional expression
questions.answer: By integrating Timorese cultural values into emotional intelligence practices

questions.question: What is a key aspect of building trust with the local community in Timor-Leste?
choices: Imposing Western practices without explanation
Maintaining strict professional boundaries at all times
Being transparent about services and processes
Avoiding all interaction with community leaders
questions.answer: Being transparent about services and processes

questions.question: How can the principle of safety be applied in community centers in Timor-Leste?
choices: By restricting access to certain community members
By creating safe spaces that respect local customs
By implementing strict Western security measures
By avoiding any discussion of safety
questions.answer: By creating safe spaces that respect local customs

questions.question: What is an important consideration when addressing gender roles in trauma-informed care in Timor-Leste?
choices: Ignoring gender differences entirely
Imposing Western gender norms
Understanding and respecting local gender expectations while promoting equality
Segregating all services by gender
questions.answer: Understanding and respecting local gender expectations while promoting equality
